publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-8015 Shirley-Anne Somerville: Marie Curie Hospice, Edinburgh—That the Parliament congratulates the Marie Curie Hospice, Edinburgh, for organising a fundraising trek to the Grand Canyon, USA; highlights that the 80 km trek, scheduled to take place from 8 to 15 October 2011, is open to anyone hoping to explore the magnificent landscape of the Grand Canyon and the Colorado River while raising what it considers to be important funds for the hospice, which treats more than 3,500 patients each year; recognises that many of those taking part, including Suzanne Hall, are taking part in support or memory of a loved one with or who has had cancer; further highlights what it believes to be the great and admirable services carried out by the staff and volunteers at the Marie Curie Hospice Edinburgh; wishes them every success with their fundraising trek, and notes that further information about the trek can be found at www.mariecurie.org.uk/en-gb/events/hospice-challenges/Edinburgh-hospice-Grand-Canyon.

S3M-8015 Shirley-Anne Somerville: Marie Curie Hospice, Edinburgh—That the Parliament congratulates the Marie Curie Hospice, Edinburgh, for organising a fundraising trek to the Grand Canyon, USA; highlights that the 80 km trek, scheduled to take place from 8 to 15 October 2011, is open to anyone hoping to explore the magnificent landscape of the Grand Canyon and the Colorado River while raising what it considers to be important funds for the hospice, which treats more than 3,500 patients each year; recognises that many of those taking part, including Suzanne Hall, are taking part in support or memory of a loved one with or who has had cancer; further highlights what it believes to be the great and admirable services carried out by the staff and volunteers at the Marie Curie Hospice Edinburgh; wishes them every success with their fundraising trek, and notes that further information about the trek can be found at www.mariecurie.org.uk/en-gb/events/hospice-challenges/Edinburgh-hospice-Grand-Canyon. Supported by: Stuart McMillan*, Mike Pringle*, Kenneth Gibson*, Malcolm Chisholm*, Bill Kidd*, Jim Hume*
S3M-8015 Marie Curie Hospice, Edinburgh (lodged on 24 February 2011) Jamie McGrigor*, Elaine Smith*, Robin Harper*
S3M-8015 Marie Curie Hospice, Edinburgh (lodged on 24 February 2011) Jamie Hepburn*
S3M-8015 Marie Curie Hospice, Edinburgh (lodged on 24 February 2011) Cathy Peattie*, Gil Paterson*
S3M-8015 Marie Curie Hospice, Edinburgh (lodged on 24 February 2011) Dave Thompson*

S3M-8015 Shirley-Anne Somerville: Marie Curie Hospice, Edinburgh—That the Parliament congratulates the Marie Curie Hospice, Edinburgh, for organising a fundraising trek to the Grand Canyon, USA; highlights that the 80 km trek, scheduled to take place from 8 to 15 October 2011, is open to anyone hoping to explore the magnificent landscape of the Grand Canyon and the Colorado River while raising what it considers to be important funds for the hospice, which treats more than 3,500 patients each year; recognises that many of those taking part, including Suzanne Hall, are taking part in support or memory of a loved one with or who has had cancer; further highlights what it believes to be the great and admirable services carried out by the staff and volunteers at the Marie Curie Hospice Edinburgh; wishes them every success with their fundraising trek, and notes that further information about the trek can be found at www.mariecurie.org.uk/en-gb/events/hospice-challenges/Edinburgh-hospice-Grand-Canyon. Supported by: Stuart McMillan, Mike Pringle, Kenneth Gibson, Malcolm Chisholm, Bill Kidd, Jim Hume, Jamie McGrigor, Elaine Smith, Robin Harper, Jamie Hepburn, Cathy Peattie, Gil Paterson, Dave Thompson
